code.name: SUCCESS
code.doc: Result code for an unmitigated success. \remarks Since an operation might succeed with the result code \em not being S1_SUCCESS you should always use #S1_SUCCESSFUL to check a result code.

code.name: E_INVALID_ARG
code.doc: Some argument was invalid (eg a pointer was \NULL). \remarks You need to use the #S1_ERROR_EQUAL flag to check for this error code.
code.doc_ext: A specific argument was invalid (eg a pointer was \NULL). \a N is the argument number and can be extracted using #S1_GET_EXTRA. The first argument has index 0. But note that for functions taking an object instance as the first argument that argument is \em not included when counting the invalid argument number. (This is not really incur a loss of information – in this case, there wouldn't be a way to obtain a library to set the error code on anyway.)

code.name: E_INVALID_FREQUENCY
code.descr: An invalid input parameter frequency was given.

code.name: E_UNKNOWN_PARAMETER
code.descr: A program input parameter is not known.

code.name: E_INCOMPATIBLE
code.descr: The requested compatibility level is not supported.
